author: Holman W. Jenkins, Jr.
title: CEOs and Politics Are a Bad Mix
text:
When a corporate leader takes a political stand you happen to favor, it’s an act of bravery. When he or she takes a stand you abhor, it’s an act of cravenness.
That’s how things play in the media, but it has little to do with the real world. A CEO who uses his corporate brand in a way that doesn’t serve the company’s interest is committing malfeasance. 

Which...
